channel.title: Rider Down
channel.description:
Well.. Here I am again, with another "boring" motorbike related topic. But, this one is a sincere one.
Anyway, on the weekend I was racing, this time it was not Motocross, but it was Longtrack. (The one where you go around a HUGE circle at like 100mph and just keep it pegged), Anyway, I was coming down the straightway at like 100mph behind one of my Motocross friend's, and he was in front of me.. And I was in behind him eating roost like a bitch. All of a sudden his bike highsides and kicks him into the air. I was nearly taken out by his bike and narrowly missed him when he landed. I knew the crash was bad, and him and I were ahead of the pack by a bit.. I immediantly slammed my breaks and laid my bike over at a very fast speed, yes, it took a lot of the skin off my left side. I quickly got up and ran over to his wreck and ran infront of him trying to signal riders to go around. Yes the yellow flag was out, but a lot of the time riders do not see it in flat track.
Anyway, he was airlifted with a neck brace and a broken wrist. His wrist was a clean break. Right through the middle, snapped in half if you will. I believe he had injuries to his back, which I hate to think if it is spinal related.
Get well soon #800.
